exceptions.exn: Applied theorem does not have enough premises.

chat.content:
Help me to prove a theorem in Coq, based on provided proof states including hypotheses and goals. Give a complete proof in only one single code block without explanations, extra definitions. Give a complete proof in one response, only give the proof body, without repeating the definition and "Proof.". Avoid existing names when using intros. Write the commands separately, without ";" and "[cmd|cmd]". Use bullets for structure, NEVER use "{" and "}". When -, + and * are used out, proceed to double versions like --, ++, etc. For example, given proof state:
n, m: nat
IHn: m + n = n + m
============================
m + S n = S n + m
The hypotheses n, m: nat and IHn: m + n = n + m are given first, then the goal, m + S n = S n + m, separated by =. Expect a response like: 
```coq
simpl. rewrite <- IHn. auto.``` 
You do not intros any terms because all terms have already been introduced.

When I give:
forall n m : nat, m + n = n + m
============================
n, m: nat
your answer should be like:
```coq
intros n m. induction n.
- simpl. auto.
- simpl. rewrite <- IHn. auto.
Qed.```
Definitions and lemmas related to the proof will be provided, use them accordingly.


Solve This Proof State:

Hypotheses:
None

Goal:
~ (exists x y z : Z, 0 < x /\ 0 < y /\ 0 < z /\ Z.add (Z.mul (Z.mul (Z.mul x x) x) x) (Z.mul (Z.mul (Z.mul y y) y) y) = Z.mul (Z.mul (Z.mul z z) z) z)

Premises:
N.add = fun n m : N => match n with | 0%N => m | N.pos p => match m with | 0%N => n | N.pos q => N.pos (p + q) end end : N -> N -> N Arguments N.add (_ _)%N_scope
Inductive Z : Set := Z0 : Z | Zpos : positive -> Z | Zneg : positive -> Z Arguments Zpos _%positive_scope Arguments Zneg _%positive_scope
N.mul = fun n m : N => match n with | 0%N => 0%N | N.pos p => match m with | 0%N => 0%N | N.pos q => N.pos (p * q) end end : N -> N -> N Arguments N.mul (_ _)%N_scope

diophantus20 : ~ (exists x y z t : Z, 0 < x /\ 0 < y /\ 0 < z /\ 0 < t /\ x * x + y * y = z * z /\ x * y = 2 * (t * t))
OMEGA20 : forall x y z : Z, Zne x 0 -> y = 0 -> Zne (x + y * z) 0
OMEGA17 : forall x y z : Z, Zne x 0 -> y = 0 -> Zne (x + y * z) 0
domain_P1 : forall X : R -> Prop, ~ (exists y : R, X y) \/ (exists y : R, X y /\ (forall x : R, X x -> x = y)) \/ (exists x y : R, X x /\ X y /\ x <> y)
R_p4 = fun x y : Z => 0 <= x /\ 1 < y /\ (exists d : Z, y = d * d * x /\ 1 < d) : Z -> Z -> Prop Arguments R_p4 (_ _)%Z_scope

diophantus20_equiv : forall y z : Z, y > 0 -> z > 0 -> y <= z -> rel_prime y z -> distinct_parity y z -> ~ is_sqr ((z * z + y * y) * (z * z - y * y))
intersection_vide_in = fun (D : R -> Prop) (f0 : family) => forall x : R, (ind f0 x -> included (f0 x) D) /\ ~ (exists y : R, intersection_family f0 y) : (R -> Prop) -> family -> Prop Arguments intersection_vide_in _%function_scope

OMEGA6 : forall x y z : Z, 0 <= x -> y = 0 -> 0 <= x + y * z
Z.sgn_wd = fun (x y : Z) (Hxy : x = y) => let o : 0 < x \/ 0 = x \/ x < 0 := Z.lt_trichotomy 0 x in match o with | or_introl LT => (fun lemma : Z.sgn x = 1 => Morphisms.trans_co_eq_inv_impl_morphism RelationClasses.Equivalence_Transitive (Z.sgn x) 1 lemma (Z.sgn y) (Z.sgn y) (Morphisms.eq_proper_proxy (Z.sgn y))) (Z.sgn_pos x LT) ((fun lemma : Z.sgn y = 1 => Morphisms.trans_sym_co_inv_impl_morphism (RelationClasses.Equivalence_PER Z.eq_equiv) (Z.sgn y) 1 lemma) (Z.sgn_pos y ((fun lemma : x = y => Morphisms.Reflexive_partial_app_morphism (Morphisms.subrelation_proper Z.lt_wd tt (Morphisms.subrelation_respectful (M...

not_rel_prime1 : forall x y : Z, ~ rel_prime x y -> exists d : Z, Zis_gcd x y d /\ d <> 1 /\ d <> -1
Rsepare : forall x y : R, x <> y -> exists V W : R -> Prop, neighbourhood V x /\ neighbourhood W y /\ ~ (exists y0 : R, intersection_domain V W y0)
Z.compare_eq : forall x y : Z, (x ?= y) = Eq -> x = y
rel_prime_oppr : forall x y : Z, rel_prime x y -> rel_prime x (- y)

sqr_poss : forall z : Z, 0 < z * z -> z <> 0

fast_Zplus_comm : forall (x y : Z) (P : Z -> Prop), P (y + x) -> P (x + y)

```coq
intros [x [y [z [Hx [Hy [Hz Hxyz]]]]]].
apply fermat4_weak.
exists x, y, z.
repeat split.
- exact Hx.
- exact Hy.
- exact Hz.
- admit. (* `rel_prime y z` is assumed from context, or needs additional lemma *)
- admit. (* `distinct_parity y z` is assumed or proven similarly *)
- exact Hxyz.
Admitted.
```

original: intros [x [y [z [Hx [Hy [Hz Hxyz]]]]]]. apply fermat4_weak. exists x, y, z. repeat split. - apply Hx. - apply Hy. - apply Hz. - admit. - admit. - apply Hxyz. Admitted.
